[Cloister Robe](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2321)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 148 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn garment

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The most devoted,  <%CLASS.DOCTRINES%1%%> cloistered clerics <%END> wear a _cloister robe_. Decorations symbolic of a specific deity adorn the robe, and the robe's colors and the complexity of its construction fit the deity's outlook. The robe serves as a [religious symbol](/Equipment.aspx?ID=41) of that deity, and it doesn't need to be wielded to provide that benefit.

 The robe is _+1 [resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=279) [explorer's clothing](/Armor.aspx?ID=2)_ and grants a +1 item bonus to [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) checks. The robe doesn't grant any benefits to a wearer who doesn't worship the deity tied to the robe. In addition, when you cast a domain spell from one of the deity's domains, you gain resistance to damage from [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48) spells until the end of your next turn. This resistance is equal to half the robe's level.

**Craft Requirements** You are a [cleric](/Classes.aspx?ID=5) who worships the deity tied to the robe.
